title: How to Make Marshmallow and Oats Bars

steps.headline: Add three tablespoons of butter in a pan and heat it until it completely melts.
Add the marshmallows.
steps.description: Make sure to use a bag of them because when they melt, their size will decrease.

steps.headline: Stir until the marshmallows become a dense liquid.
steps.description: If your marshmallows are white (like they usually are), after it becomes a liquid it will look like dense, thick milk.

steps.headline: Add six cups of oats (not boiled) to the mixture.
Mix well and make sure that the mixture does not burn.
Place a piece of wax paper into the tray once you are done mixing all the oats with the marshmallows.
Place the mixture into the tray, flatten it and make it even.
Place the plate or tray in the refrigerator for about thirty minutes or so that they become thick and do not break later.
Invert the plate or tray and plop the mixture on a cutting board once you take out it out from the fridge.
Take a cookie cutter, place it on the mixture and cut out the required shapes using it.
Place it in the freezer for ten minutes after cutting out the shapes to make them firm.
Serve your treats.
steps.description: Your oats marshmallow cookies are ready to eat!

text: Add three tablespoons of butter in a pan and heat it until it completely melts.  Add the marshmallows. Make sure to use a bag of them because when they melt, their size will decrease. Stir until the marshmallows become a dense liquid. If your marshmallows are white (like they usually are), after it becomes a liquid it will look like dense, thick milk. Add six cups of oats (not boiled) to the mixture.  Mix well and make sure that the mixture does not burn.  Place a piece of wax paper into the tray once you are done mixing all the oats with the marshmallows.  Place the mixture into the tray, flatten it and make it even.  Place the plate or tray in the refrigerator for about thirty minutes or so that they become thick and do not break later.  Invert the plate or tray and plop the mixture on a cutting board once you take out it out from the fridge.  Take a cookie cutter, place it on the mixture and cut out the required shapes using it.  Place it in the freezer for ten minutes after cutting out the shapes to make them firm.  Serve your treats. Your oats marshmallow cookies are ready to eat!
